intro: Rhododendron hartleyi, commonly known as Hartley's rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of western China. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in cool, moist habitats at high elevations. The plant features lance-shaped, dark green leaves and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to red. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically important species. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native range.
